alert.note: Alert for Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:34PM CDT until May 30 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ROCK COUNTY... At 333 PM CDT, tornado producing storms were located along a line extending from near Jasper to 6 miles west of Blue Mounds State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Public confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Hardwick and Blue Mounds State Park. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
